Description: A complete large dark brown, almost black, woven mat made of human hair. The weave is plain, balenced and open. The hair yarns are twisted in 's'-direction. The selvedges are reinforced and both of the edges have fringes. At the starting border pairs of closed loops 30mm long are 'z'-plied and tied in knots at the edge of the weave. At the ending border, groups of eight warps area 'z'-plied and knotted at the end to form a fringe 50mm long. The warp thread count is 6 per 10mm. The weft thread count is 7 per 10mm.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p.61, 63, pl. 15E, F)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.1 (excavation object cat. no.)
